now I taught through the epic program
and I did I did a brief like a brief
stint at hog Wan but I kind of have a
little bit of a perspective on both
sides I still prefer the epic program
and I'll tell you why now I'm the kind
of person that appreciates stability and
I think just felt a little more stable
than the hog one systems and that's
because you are working in the public
schools it's a government run and funded
program so it's an institution which
means it's lockdown and if anything
changes in that program then all the
teachers in epic and all the public
schools are affected by that change or
you know if it's in your district if
there's a change in your district then
every school in your district feels that
change ah gwaan it is a privately run
and owned business and there are
thousands of them throughout Korea but
their system is a little different if
there's a change then it's only within
that school now hagwons
operate on after school hours basically
they are like extracurricular learning
programs because that's all Koreans do
is extremely like learn that means
anywhere you know like your schedule
singing we're from 2:00 to 9:00 at night
and I don't think the schedules are set
so each week you know you'll you'll have
to see what your schedules going to be
they also operate during the weekends
and holidays
which brings me to the next point 21
days in epic for vacation versus ten
days at a hog on
for me there was no comparison because I
love to travel and when I loved when I
travel I like big chunks of time
especially if I'm gonna be traveling
abroad to like other neighboring
countries so with epic uh because you
know we have winter and summer breaks I
was able to use that time and split them
up you know into a winter and summer
break whereas I think with the hug ones
the business owners choose when in your
schedule you can take your your vacation
days also with epic you have holidays
like Korean national holidays and you
can enjoy those times because you're
working in the public school what I
really loved about epic was that they
had a good support system or I felt like
it was a good support system when you
were inducted into the program you know
the first week that you're in Korea it
is a week-long orientation they offer
where you get to meet other people in

connections as well as they administer
like these intensive workshops on you
know how to lesson plan on how to teach
in the Korean environment you know how
to navigate Korean culture
kind of give you those sprinkles of what
you're going to expect or what to expect
when you go go off on your own as well
as they touch bases with you every once
in a while your district will touch
bases with you and kind of tell you give
you information about you know like
summer camps winter camps when you can
take your vacation another great thing
is throughout the year there would be
little excursions and activities for
epic epic teachers which is kind of like
a nice way for us to all get together if
we haven't seen each other for a while
another thing that I discovered a little
later is that the epic program is
recognized as teaching experience if I
ever wanted to teach at a university or

recognize my experience as viable
experience if I were to teach at ha Guan
they wouldn't recognize that experiences
teaching experience there's a difference

you're allowed to be more creative you
